    • buyABook

      public boolean buyABook(String name, double price, Book tempBook)
      The function adds a book to the user's products and creates a bill for the purchase.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the book being bought.
      price - The price of the book being bought.
      tempBook - The "tempBook" parameter is an object of the class "Book". It is being passed as an argument to the method "buyABook".
      Returns:
      A boolean value is being returned.

    • suscribe

      public boolean suscribe(String name, double subscribeCost, Magazine tempMagazine)
      This Java function adds a new bill and a magazine to a user's products when they subscribe to the magazine.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the user who wants to subscribe to the magazine.
      subscribeCost - The cost of subscribing to the magazine.
      tempMagazine - The "tempMagazine" parameter is an object of the class "Magazine". It is being passed as an argument to the method "subscribe" along with the "name" and "subscribeCost" parameters. The method is using this object to add the magazine to the user's list of subscribed
      Returns:
      A boolean value is being returned.

    • organizeByDatePremium

      public void organizeByDatePremium()
      This function organizes a list of user products by their publication date in ascending order.

    • fillLibraryPremium

      public ArrayList<String[][]> fillLibraryPremium()
      This function fills an ArrayList with 5x5 matrices of user product IDs, with each matrix containing up to 25 product IDs.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of 2D String arrays, where each 2D array represents a premium library filled with the user's products.

    • showMatrix

      public String showMatrix()
      The function returns a string representation of a matrix filled with data from a list of string arrays.
      Returns:
      The method `showMatrix()` returns a `String` that represents a matrix of strings. The matrix is created by iterating over an `ArrayList` of `String` arrays and concatenating the elements of each array into a string, separated by spaces and newlines. The resulting string is then returned.

    • lectureSimulatorPremium

      public String lectureSimulatorPremium(int page, int totalPages, String name)
      The function returns a message for a premium lecture simulator with information about the current page being read and options to navigate.
      Parameters:
      page - The current page being read by the user.
      totalPages - The total number of pages in the book being read.
      name - a String representing the name of the book being read
      Returns:
      The method is returning a String message that includes the name of the book being read, the current page number, the total number of pages, and instructions for the user to navigate through the reading session.
